articles.headline: The Subprime Loan Machine
articles.snippet: A little-noticed tool of automated underwriting software helped fuel the recent subprime mortgage boom.
articles.abstract: A little-noticed tool of automated underwriting software helped fuel the recent subprime mortgage boom.
articles.lead_paragraph: Edward N. Jones, a former NASA engineer for the Apollo and Skylab missions, looked at low-income home buyers nearly a decade ago and saw an unexplored frontier.

articles.headline: Surging Real Estate Values Put Giant French Retailer in Play
articles.snippet: Carrefour, the world’s second-largest retailer, faces a dynastic squabble and pressure from powerful investors hunting for profit.
articles.abstract: Carrefour, the world’s second-largest retailer, faces a dynastic squabble and pressure from powerful investors hunting for profit.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS, March 22 — Carrefour, Europe’s answer to Wal-Mart and the world’s second-largest retailer, is in play.

articles.headline: News Corp. and NBC in Web Deal
articles.snippet: Hoping to rival YouTube, the two media companies will showcase their own programming across the Internet.
articles.abstract: Hoping to rival YouTube, the two media companies will showcase their own programming across the Internet.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a long-anticipated challenge to YouTube and other online video sites, two big media companies yesterday announced a new venture to showcase their own programming across the Internet’s biggest Web sites, as well as a new jointly owned Web destination.

articles.headline: Blackstone Says It Plans to Go Public
articles.snippet: The largest private equity firm in the nation will seek an initial public offering that would value the firm at as much as $40 billion.
articles.abstract: The largest private equity firm in the nation will seek an initial public offering that would value the firm at as much as $40 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a firestorm of speculation, the Blackstone Group, the largest private equity firm in the nation, said yesterday that it would seek an initial public offering that would value the firm at as much as $40 billion and that would offer a first glimpse inside its closely guarded money machine.

articles.headline: Oracle Says Rival Stole Its Software
articles.snippet: Oracle has sued its rival SAP, accusing the big German software maker of intruding into its computer systems to carry out “corporate theft on a grand scale.”
articles.abstract: Oracle has sued its rival SAP, accusing the big German software maker of intruding into its computer systems to carry out “corporate theft on a grand scale.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Oracle sued its rival SAP yesterday, accusing the big German software maker of intruding into its computer systems to carry out “corporate theft on a grand scale.”

articles.headline: Foreclosures Force Suburbs to Fight Blight
articles.snippet: Suburbs of Cleveland are spending millions to maintain vacant houses as they try to contain real-estate panic.
articles.abstract: Suburbs of Cleveland are spending millions to maintain vacant houses as they try to contain real-estate panic.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHAKER HEIGHTS, Ohio — In a sign of the spreading economic fallout of mortgage foreclosures, several suburbs of Cleveland, one of the nation’s hardest-hit cities, are spending millions of dollars to maintain vacant houses as they try to contain blight and real-estate panic.

articles.headline: Reclaiming Homes, Iraqis Find Peril
articles.snippet: As families begin to return to the Baghdad neighborhoods they fled, the threat of sectarian violence remains very real.
articles.abstract: As families begin to return to the Baghdad neighborhoods they fled, the threat of sectarian violence remains very real.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, March 22 — When Hazim Said and his family returned to their house in southwestern Baghdad on March 1, two months after fleeing a murder and intimidation campaign by Sunni Arab insurgents, Mr. Said’s wife and two sons collapsed to the floor in tears of joy and kissed the walls.

articles.headline: In Some States, Maker Oversees Use of Its Drug
articles.snippet: Eli Lilly has offered to monitor doctors to make sure they are not wasting money on mental illness drugs.
articles.abstract: Eli Lilly has offered to monitor doctors to make sure they are not wasting money on mental illness drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Many states, looking to rein in the cost of expensive antipsychotic drugs like Zyprexa, have turned to an unusual ally for help  the very company that sells the drug.

articles.headline: Edwards Says Wife’s Cancer Has Returned
articles.snippet: John Edwards proclaimed that he would continue his bid for the presidency, saying, “The campaign goes on strongly.”
articles.abstract: John Edwards proclaimed that he would continue his bid for the presidency, saying, “The campaign goes on strongly.”
articles.lead_paragraph: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., March 22 — John Edwards, the North Carolina Democrat, said Thursday that his wife’s cancer had returned in incurable form. He proclaimed that he would continue his bid for the presidency, saying, “The campaign goes on strongly.”
articles.byline: By John M. Broder and Adam Nagourney
